title: CTRL0000061477 - Transcribed Interview of William B. Harrison, (April 7, 2022)

data.text: JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
The interview in the above matter was held via Webex, commencing at 10:04 a.m.
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
This is a transcribed interview of William Harrison conducted by the House Select
Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack on the United States Capitol pursuant to
Mr. Harrison, could you please state your full name and spell your last name for
In the room today are PI
This will be a staff-led interview, and members of the committee
may choose to join and ask questions.
As of now, there are none with us today.
But before we begin, I'll just go over a few ground rules.
You are permitted to have an attorney present, and I see you do have your
So I'd ask you to please introduce yourself and spell your last name for the record.
Stefan Passantino, P, as in Paul, a-s-s, as in Sam,
There is an official reporter transcribing the record of this deposition.
wait until each question is completed before you begin your response, and we'll wait to
ask the next question until you're done.
We might at some time ask you to spell something if it's not clear for the record.
And also, if you give a nonverbal response, like shaking or nodding your head,
we'll just ask you to say yes or no so it's clear on the record, okay?
We only ask that you provide complete answers based on the best
If a question we ask is not clear, just tell us and we'll do our best to
And if you don't know the answer, just say so.
Also, I want to remind you, as we do all witnesses, that it is unlawful to
deliberately provide false information to Congress.
You and your attorney will also have an opportunity to review the transcript once
So are there any questions before we get going?
So, Mr. Harrison, how old are you?
= And what's your highest level of education?
And what year did you graduate?
Current occupation would be a split between GSA and, yes, a political entity.
Prior to the jobs you have now, we understand that you worked at the White
What was the length of your tenure?
I started on January 21st of 2017, and my last day was January 20th of 2021.
Can you just summarize or tell us the roles you had over the course of your
When did you start and when did you
I started the first year -- the first year and a half, from January of '17
to August of -- July of 2018, I was in the Office of Presidential Advance.
through 2021, I was in kind of a division of the chief of staff's office overseeing White
If we're going to focus on the time period of November 2020 to January
of 2021, what was your title during that time period?
During that period of November '20 to January of '21, I was deputy assistant
Who did you report to during that time?
My direct report was Anthony Ornato, who was the deputy chief of staff for
Did you have anyone reporting to you during that time period?
No, like, direct reports, but we had kind of oversight and management of a
number of different White House divisions, I guess.
iIt's a fair point, and actually this leads into the next question.
Just at a high level, what were the responsibilities that you had as the deputy chief
Like I said, oversight kind of within a few different of
the supporting entities of the Office of the President itself.
Kind of the campus, the runnings of the
actual White House campus, whether it be facilities, the comings and goings of staff
It would be the President's travel, his Secret Service detail, the White House
Military Office, and then the IT, kind of information technology support of the office itself.
Did you have anybody who was at the same level within you, also a deputy,
or were you the only one underneath Mr. Ornato?
With respect to events off ground, given your background in advance, did
you -- was there any particular or special role you played with regard to when the
President would travel off White House grounds for any events?
I mean, we kind of were in charge of kind of
making -- ensuring the kind of more logistical pieces were in place as it related to, again,
his Secret Service, but the White House military, kind of the rolling bubble that allows the
President to be the President when he's -- or he or she is outside of the White House.
As we understand it, the Office of Advance reported in to Mr. Ornato.
Wealso understand that Mr. Ornato would have at least on a regular basis
meetings on Monday, Wednesdays, and Fridays.
And what was the purpose of those meetings?
The purpose was to get the heads of each of kind of the divisions that he and
And it was just to kind of synch up and just kind of make
sure that everybody's on the same page with all the different moving pieces.
Soif, for instance, there was an event off White House grounds that was
coming up, that would be a topic of conversation at these meetings?
Yeah, that would be brought up.
Were there any other standing meetings that you had in your role, just on a
regular basis, that would relate to the movement of the President off grounds?

You said you worked in part or had a role in the President's
schedule, or at least knowing what the schedule would be.
related to scheduling that you attended regularly?
Not -- I mean, nothing -- I can't remember anything like a regularly scheduled
I mean, I think it was a lot of -- it was just kind of as -- a lot of the stuff was just
There were -- I think there were efforts to kind of -- I mean, for 4 years
there, there were efforts to come up with a system for scheduling that worked.
In the heat of, like, the political travel, I think that there was a meeting that
It wasn't regular, but it was when they were getting some direction of where
the rallies were going to be, when they were going to be.
know, I don't think it was anything that was on every Wednesday at 10 a.m. or anything

just kind of for historical paper purposes with document production and things like that.

I think that at that time the

gathered, that would be the responsibility of the Secret Service to then pass to us

We would be a consumer of it.
lawyer I have to follow up on those.

Can you explain that a little bit more?
Soif you get something from the Secret Service, it's a report or

I think that it was anything that was -- that we deemed significant.

I can't give any -- I can't think of any specific example.
think with anything you can kind of get a sense of what needs to be elevated and what

documents that we would want to show you.

I don't know if it was a preferred, but it was largely just by

the quickest way to do it most of the time.
On that last point, your office, was it the same floor as Mr.

The how would be we probably would have been told -- again, and that's a

Yeah, I was off from Christmas through New Year's through -- yeah, so
Christmas through New Year's I was kind of on leave.
And New Year's Day was a Friday, which means the next business day it was
Monday, January 4th, which puts January 6th ona Wednesday.
And were you in the office on January Sth?
And were you at the office on January 6th?
Were you back at the office on Monday, January 4th?
Weunderstand that Mr. Ornato, like you, was also on leave during the

I mean, first memory would be just the logistical items of everything from

The method of the President getting
And that would be -- I mean, that was kind of the early, I guess, early stages.
Doyou recall working or hearing about that while you were on your break,
or was it when you got back to work on January 4th?
mean, it would have -- those things take time.
But -- yeah, I don't remember specifically.
So it would have been probably before.
When we've talked to other people about how they characterize events the
President appears at, most people talk about a difference between an official event and a
Do those characterizations make sense to you?
What was your understanding of the nature of the event on the 6th at the

did that change in any way the standard process that you all would go through on the

The ownership was shifted a little bit where the kind of host group was more
of the political entity or organization that was behind it, which would have been the
campaign and the other kind of fringe groups that were associated with the campaign.
But they largely would have control.
And it was our -- at least for the way that
the political events were broken down, it was just kind of we would take a back seat and
make sure that the items were in place that had to be in place for a number of different
continuity reasons and things like that.
Was there anything about the planning and work on this event that
stood out as unusual or out of the ordinary based on your experience over the 4 years?
I mean, the location, I guess.
I mean, just that we hadn't done a
And anything, any event on the Ellipse is a little unusual.
like the Christmas tree lighting just presents challenges because you have to go through a
bunch of hula hoops with NPS and others.
ill get into more specifics on certain points, but I just

For the actual event itself it was kind

essentially directing them of how to get there.
participating it was, how do people come into work that were supposed to come into
And for others that were not

That was basically the extent of it.

that started, but we were given an idea of just how many people would be in the

Yeah, it would be the Vice President's staff.
lot of that was driven through in his chief.
an operations person, it was mainly his chief of staff that would -- and then would work

particularly something that was discussed and considered?

not providing the answers, to your knowledge?
